page.title: 16LOCAL PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: {The Hurdlemakers Arms }A small pub, popular in Woodham Mortimer.The only one of its name in England.A cold breeze blowing through the back door. The landlord,Mr Field and his wife answering questions.Fascinating tankards,named for the customers. Beautiful lamps in the dark corners. A fizzing orange given to us by Mrs Field.Parts of the pub are over 200 years old.It has an old peg tiled roof Only three landlords in 100 years. {The Bell }built in 1563,a quaint pub in the centre of Woodham Walter.It had always been owned locally until Inde-Coop bought it.Most customers visit from outside the area by car.Men drink mainly beer whilst ladies prefer wine or soft drinks.It has a small restaurant serving lunchtime meals and a three course evening menu.l4 local people are employed part-time.
